works.description:
I am one of several attorneys retained 

to represent Paige Duke and her family regarding the unlawful distribution
 
of illegally obtained photographs.  You will likely also soon receive a  
letter of demand from her copyright attorney, Edward Fenno, Esq.  This  
email as well as the letter that follows it are intended as notice and  
request for removal of the photographs pursuant to the Digital Millennium 

Copyright Act (17 U.S. Code Section 512(c)(3)).

     These illegally obtained nude photos of Ms. Duke have been posted on 

your website, zrojones.blogspot.com.com.  Publication of these photos  
constitutes an unlawful invasion of Ms. Duke's privacy.  She did not  
authorize their publication on your website, nor did she authorize the  
display of these photos to your subscribers or to the general public.  Ms.
 
Duke is the author of these photographs and, as such, holds the copyright 

to these photographs.  Your copying (even for electronic storage
purposes),  
display and/or distribution of these photos constitutes infringement of
Ms.  
Duke's copyrights.

     Ms. Duke hereby demands that you remove the photos and all links to
the  
photos from your website and from any electronic storage.   As referenced 

above, pursuant to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (17 U.S. Code  
Section 512(c)(3)):

*  The works are the original nude photos of Ms. Duke referenced above;
*  The infringing works are the copies of the photos posted on your  
website, and any additional copies stored on your servers and /or
displayed  
elsewhere on your website;
*  You can reach Ms. Duke or me at the address listed below;
*  The use of the photos in the manner in which you are using them is not 

authorized by Ms. Duke as copyright owner, any agent of hers -- not is it 

permissible by law;

Please contact me immediately to confirm that you agree to remove the  
photographs and all links to the photos from your website and from any and
 
all servers associated with your website, that you have begun the removal 

process, and that you will complete the removal process as quickly as  
possible.  Due to the urgency of this matter, if we have not received an  
affirmative response from you by 8:00 pm ET this evening, we will assume  
that you do not intend to cooperate with this demand and we will proceed  
accordingly.

Thank you for your anticipated prompt attention to this matter.  I look  
forward to hearing from you.


Mandy Powers Norrell, Esq.
Norrell Powers Norrell, LLC
Attorneys at Law
PO Box  994
Lancaster, SC  29721
803-289-1800 (o)
resipsa@comporium.net
